lead_paragraph: 11:38 a.m. | Updated An article in The Atlantic just posted online has renewed an intense discussion among women about how best – and whether – to balance family and career, Jodi Kantor writes. It is a discussion, admittedly, among elite women who are at the top of their fields, including the comedian Tina Fey, the Facebook executive Sheryl Sandberg and the author of the Atlantic article, Anne-Marie Slaughter, a Princeton professor who recently left a job at the State Department. The pace of the arguments about the article, “Why Women Still Can’t Have It All,” reflects the Internet age, Ms. Kantor writes:

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: On ‘Having It All’ (or Some), and Cracks at NBC News
